description.full: A Topic object allows you to interact with a Google Cloud Pub/Sub topic.
description.summary: A Topic object allows you to interact with a Google Cloud Pub/Sub topic.

tags.html:
topic.create(function(err, topic, apiResponse) {
if (!err) {
// The topic was created successfully.
}
});

description.full: Delete the topic. This will not delete subscriptions to this topic.
description.summary: Delete the topic. This will not delete subscriptions to this topic.

tags.string:
{?error} callback.err - An error returned while making this
    request.
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error returned while making this request.

tags.string: {boolean} callback.exists - Whether the topic exists or not.
tags.name: callback.exists

tags.string:
{boolean} options.autoCreate - Automatically create the object if
    it does not exist. Default: `false`
tags.name: options.autoCreate
tags.description: • Automatically create the object if it does not exist. Default: false

description.full:
Get a topic if it exists.

You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an
object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is
normally required for the create method must be contained within this
object as well.
description.body:
You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an
object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is
normally required for the create method must be contained within this
object as well.

tags.string:
{?error} callback.err - An error returned while making this
    request.
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error returned while making this request.

tags.string: {object} callback.metadata - The metadata of the Topic.
tags.name: callback.metadata

description.full: Get the official representation of this topic from the API.
description.summary: Get the official representation of this topic from the API.

tags.html:
//-
// Get the IAM policy for your topic.
//-
topic.iam.getPolicy(function(err, policy) {
console.log(policy);
});

description.full:
IAM (Identity and Access Management)
allows you to set permissions on invidual resources and offers a wider
range of roles: editor, owner, publisher, subscriber, and viewer. This
gives you greater flexibility and allows you to set more fine-grained
access control.

The IAM access control features described in this document are Beta,
including the API methods to get and set IAM policies, and to test IAM
permissions. Google Cloud Pub/Sub's use of IAM features is not covered by
any SLA or deprecation policy, and may be subject to backward-incompatible
changes.
description.summary:
IAM (Identity and Access Management)
allows you to set permissions on invidual resources and offers a wider
range of roles: editor, owner, publisher, subscriber, and viewer. This
gives you greater flexibility and allows you to set more fine-grained
access control.
description.body:
The IAM access control features described in this document are Beta,
including the API methods to get and set IAM policies, and to test IAM
permissions. Google Cloud Pub/Sub's use of IAM features is not covered by
any SLA or deprecation policy, and may be subject to backward-incompatible
changes.

description.full: Format a message object as the upstream API expects it.
description.summary: Format a message object as the upstream API expects it.

description.full:
Format the name of a topic. A Topic's full name is in the format of
'projects/{projectId}/topics/{topicName}'.
description.summary:
Format the name of a topic. A Topic's full name is in the format of
'projects/{projectId}/topics/{topicName}'.

tags.string: {number=} options.pageSize - Maximum number of results to return.
tags.name: options.pageSize

tags.html:
var callback = function(err, subscriptions, nextQuery, apiResponse) {
// If nextQuery is non-null, there may be more results to fetch. To do
// so, run topic.getSubscriptions(nextQuery, callback);.
};

// Get all subscriptions for this topic.
topic.getSubscriptions(callback);

// Customize the query.
topic.getSubscriptions({
pageSize: 3
}, callback);

//-
// Get the subscriptions for this topic as a readable object stream.
//-
topic.getSubscriptions()
.on('error', console.error)
.on('data', function(subscription) {
// subscription is a Subscription object.
})
.on('end', function() {
// All subscriptions retrieved.
});

//-
// If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent
// unnecessary processing and API requests.
//-
topic.getSubscriptions()
.on('data', function(subscription) {
this.end();
});

description.full:
Get a list of the subscriptions registered to this topic. You may optionally
provide a query object as the first argument to customize the response.

Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error
occurred or an array of {@linkcode module:pubsub/subscription} objects.
description.summary:
Get a list of the subscriptions registered to this topic. You may optionally
provide a query object as the first argument to customize the response.
description.body:
Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error
occurred or an array of {@linkcode module:pubsub/subscription} objects.

tags.string: {Error} If a message is missing a data property.
tags.description: If a message is missing a data property.

tags.string: {*} message.data - The contents of the message.
tags.name: message.data

tags.string:
{array=} message.attributes - Key/value pair of attributes to apply to
    the message. All values must be strings.
tags.name: message.attributes
tags.description: • Key/value pair of attributes to apply to the message. All values must be strings.

tags.html:
topic.publish({
data: 'Hello, world!'
}, function(err, messageIds, apiResponse) {});

//-
// The data property can be a JSON object as well.
//-
var registerMessage = {
data: {
userId: 3,
name: 'Stephen',
event: 'new user'
},
attributes: {
key: 'value',
hello: 'world'
}
};

topic.publish(registerMessage, function(err, messageIds, apiResponse) {});

//-
// You can publish a batch of messages at once by supplying an array.
//-
var purchaseMessage = {
data: {
userId: 3,
product: 'computer',
event: 'purchase'
}
};

topic.publish([
registerMessage,
purchaseMessage
], function(err, messageIds, apiResponse) {});

description.full:
Publish the provided message or array of messages. On success, an array of
messageIds is returned in the response.
description.summary:
Publish the provided message or array of messages. On success, an array of
messageIds is returned in the response.

tags.string: {string} subName - The name of the subscription.
tags.name: subName

tags.string:
{number=} options.ackDeadlineSeconds - The maximum time after
    receiving a message that you must ack a message before it is redelivered.
tags.name: options.ackDeadlineSeconds
tags.description: • The maximum time after receiving a message that you must ack a message before it is redelivered.

tags.string:
{boolean=} options.autoAck - Automatically acknowledge the message
    once it's pulled. (default: false)
tags.name: options.autoAck
tags.description: • Automatically acknowledge the message once it's pulled. (default: false)

tags.string:
{string} options.encoding - When pulling for messages, this type is
    used when converting a message's data to a string. (default: 'utf-8')
tags.name: options.encoding
tags.description: • When pulling for messages, this type is used when converting a message's data to a string. (default: 'utf-8')

tags.string:
{number=} options.interval - Interval in milliseconds to check for new
    messages. (default: 10)
tags.name: options.interval
tags.description: • Interval in milliseconds to check for new messages. (default: 10)

tags.string:
{number} options.maxInProgress - Maximum messages to consume
    simultaneously.
tags.name: options.maxInProgress

tags.string:
{boolean=} options.reuseExisting - If the subscription already exists,
    reuse it. The options of the existing subscription are not changed. If
    false, attempting to create a subscription that already exists will fail.
    (default: false)
tags.name: options.reuseExisting
tags.description:
• If the subscription already exists, reuse it. The options of the existing subscription are not changed. If
    false, attempting to create a subscription that already exists will fail.
    (default: false)

tags.string:
{number} options.timeout - Set a maximum amount of time in
    milliseconds on an HTTP request to pull new messages to wait for a
    response before the connection is broken.
tags.name: options.timeout
tags.description:
• Set a maximum amount of time in milliseconds on an HTTP request to pull new messages to wait for a
    response before the connection is broken.

tags.html:
// Without specifying any options.
topic.subscribe('newMessages', function(err, subscription, apiResponse) {});

// With options.
topic.subscribe('newMessages', {
ackDeadlineSeconds: 90,
autoAck: true,
interval: 30
}, function(err, subscription, apiResponse) {});

description.full:
Create a subscription to this topic. You may optionally provide an object to
customize the subscription.

Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error
occurred or a {@linkcode module:pubsub/subscription} object.
description.summary:
Create a subscription to this topic. You may optionally provide an object to
customize the subscription.
description.body:
Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error
occurred or a {@linkcode module:pubsub/subscription} object.

tags.string:
{boolean=} options.autoAck - Automatically acknowledge the message
    once it's pulled.
tags.name: options.autoAck
tags.description: • Automatically acknowledge the message once it's pulled.

tags.string:
{number=} options.interval - Interval in milliseconds to check for new
    messages.
tags.name: options.interval
tags.description: • Interval in milliseconds to check for new messages.

tags.html:
var subscription = topic.subscription('my-subscription');

// Register a listener for message events.
subscription.on('message', function(message) {
// Called every time a message is received.
// message.id = ID used to acknowledge its receival.
// message.data = Contents of the message.
// message.attributes = Attributes of the message.
});

description.full:
Create a Subscription object. This command by itself will not run any API
requests. You will receive a {@linkcode module:pubsub/subscription} object,
which will allow you to interact with a subscription.
description.summary:
Create a Subscription object. This command by itself will not run any API
requests. You will receive a {@linkcode module:pubsub/subscription} object,
which will allow you to interact with a subscription.
